title: Strategies for Forming Language-Based Learning Communities in Online Health Science Education: Utilizing Medical Terminology and Academic Expressions

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational health science concept comprehension, online learning tool usage experience, understanding of medical terminology and academic expressions, basic grammar structures and text analysis skills
context.additional_context: For pre-service and in-service teachers, this program integrates smartphone-based VR environments, project-based assessment, and teacher-student interaction. It emphasizes communication skills using specialized terminology and academic expressions in health sciences, with comprehensive evaluation of reading comprehension, expression, and writing abilities.

learning_goals: Learners conduct collaborative problem-solving activities using specialized terminology and academic expressions in health sciences at least three times in online discussion forums, applying community learning principles

Learners provide at least two peer feedbacks in VR-based simulation environments using specialized medical terminology and structured expressions through health science case studies, evaluating feedback clarity and logical coherence

Learners analyze their participation patterns (degree centrality, betweenness centrality, etc.) using learner network analysis tools like Gephi or NodeXL across three metrics, and create implementation plans including at least three action items (e.g., vocabulary diversification, sentence structure improvement) to enhance communication efficiency

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
